availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Matilda Watts Yeates in 1833. Father of William H. Yeates, Richard W. Yeates, and Mary E. Yeates. Farmer in Anderson County in 1850 and 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850 and eight in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 225. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 101. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 60. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 12. Yates Publishing, U.S. and International Marriage Records, 1560-1900, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1833, source no 9721.000. Find A Grave, "Enoch Yeates (1812-1878)," Memorial #76126968, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=76126968 (accessed May 7, 2017).
